class.name: jsx3.gui.Heavyweight
class.text: GUI utility class that provides a way to display HTML content on-screen in an HTML equivalent of a heavyweight container. Instances of this class are often used to display menu lists, select lists, spyglass, and focus-rectangles. An instance of this class cannot be serialized, it is merely a run-time construct similar to an alert or input box.

param.name: strId
param.text: id to identify this HW instance among all others; this id will be used by both jsx3.gui.Heavyweight (to index it in the hash) and by the browser as the HTML tag's "id" attribute. If no ID is passed, a unique ID will be assigned by the system and is available by calling, [object].getId();

method.name: GO

param.name: strId
param.text: unique ID for the heavyweight instance

method.text: Returns the instance of the heavyweight object with the given ID; to get the on-screen HTML instance call: jsx3.gui.Heavyweight.GO([id]).getRendered()

method.name: show

param.name: bDisplay
param.text: true if null; if true, the heavyweight container is positioned and displayed immediately; if false, the container is painted on-screen, but its CSS 'visibility' property is set to 'hidden', allowing the developer to adjust as needed (via 2-pass, etc) before actually displaying;

method.name: applyRatio
method.text: can be called if show() has been called; resets the ratio (width/total) of the VIEW to be that of [object].getRatio()

method.name: applyRules

param.name: strAxis
param.text: character (string) representing whether the rule is for the X or Y axis. Rememeber to capitalize!

method.text: can be called if show() has been called; allows an existing HW window to re-apply its rules (used for complex layouts requiring a multi-pass)

method.name: hide
method.text: destorys the on-screen VIEW for the HW container; Hide() only affects the VIEW; this is not the same as setting visibility to "hidden", which doesn't actually destroy the VIEW

method.name: getDomParent
method.text: Returns an object reference to the Browser Element parent to be used; if none specified, the browser BODY will be used

method.name: setDomParent

param.name: objGUI
param.text: HTML element in the browser

method.text: Sets an object reference to the Browser Element parent to be used; if none specified, the browser BODY will be used. Note that this method must be called before setting any point rules for the hW instance, so those functions know the true origin from which to calculate left/top positions; returns ref to self

method.name: getRatio
method.text: Returns the ratio (a decimal between .01 and .99) to multiply the "Rise + Run" by. When applied by the 'show' command during a double-pass, a width to height ratio can be established to provide a consistent L&F for the text content. For example, a value of .8 would mean that the width of the heavyweight container would represent 80% and the height would represent 20% of the total perimiter

method.name: setRatio

param.name: vntRatio
param.text: any value between .01 and .99

method.text: Sets the ratio (a decimal between .01 and .99) to multiply the "Rise + Run" by. When applied by the 'show' command during a double-pass, a width to height ratio can be established to provide a consistent L&F for the text content. For example, a value of .8 would mean that the width of the heavyweight container would represent 80% and the height would represent 20% of the total perimiter; returns a ref to self

method.name: getOverflow
method.text: Returns the overflow property for CONTENTS of the HW container; it is assumed that anytime a perfect fit cannot occur that the content will have its overflow property set to 'auto' unless specified otherwise

method.name: setOverflow

param.name: strOverflow

method.name: setVisibility

param.name: strVisibility
param.text: [jsx3.gui.Block.VISIBILITYVISIBLE, jsx3.gui.Block.VISIBILITYHIDDEN]

method.text: if the HW instance has an on-screen VIEW, this method can be used to toggle its visibility; it has no effect on the MODEL; it is most commonly used when "[object].show(false);" is called, allowing the developer to manually adjust layout before actually showing the HW instance. returns a ref to self for method chaining

method.name: getZIndex
method.text: Returns the z-index property; assumes jsx3.gui.Heavyweight.DEFAULTZINDEX if none supplied

method.name: setZIndex

method.name: getWidth
method.text: Returns the CSS width property (in pixels); if this value is set, it is assumed that the Heavyweight container will not have its width lessened to fit on-screen.

method.name: setWidth

param.name: intWidth
param.text: width (in pixels)

method.text: Sets the CSS width property (in pixels); if this value is set, it is assumed that the Heavyweight container will not have its width lessened to fit on-screen.

method.name: getHeight
method.text: Returns the CSS height property (in pixels); if this value is set, it is assumed that the Heavyweight container will not have its height lessened to fit on-screen.

method.name: setHeight

param.name: intHeight
param.text: height (in pixels)

method.text: Sets the CSS height property (in pixels); if this value is set, it is assumed that the Heavyweight container will not have its height lessened to fit on-screen. returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: addXRule

param.name: objAnchor
param.text: Either an event, or an on-screen HTML element

param.name: strAnchorPoint
param.text: REQUIRED if @objAnchor is an HTML element; when used, defines one of the valid 9 compass points: 4 primary: (N, S, E, W); 4 secondary: (NE, SE, SW, NW); and origin: (O). Note that it is from this point (on @objAnchor) that the heavyweight item will try to position itself

param.name: strPoint
param.text: Defines one of the valid 9 compass points: 4 primary: (N, S, E, W); 4 secondary: (NE, SE, SW, NW); and origin: (O). Note that it is from this point (on the Heavyweight instance) that the heavyweight item will try to position itself

param.name: intOff
param.text: offset (in pixels) by which to nudge the horizontal placement of the HW instance before displaying (useful for submenus, for example, where their left has a -10px offset to overlay the parent menu item)

method.text: adds a POSITION RULE ruleset (X value) (a simple structure/hash) to the array of position rules; Note that POSITION RULE objects are used by the show() method to determine the best possible location for a heavyweight item

method.name: getPositionRule

param.name: intIndex
param.text: the index (in rank order of execution) of the POSITION RULEing rule set to apply (it is assumed that at least one POSITION RULE ruleset exists)

param.name: strAxis
param.text: character (string) representing whether the rule is for the X or Y axis. Rememeber to capitalize!

method.text: Returns a POSITION RULE object at the given index; Note that POSITION RULE objects are JavaScript objects that implement the following 3 properties: _pixel (the on-screen point around which to pivot/place), _offset (amount to nudge the placement), _point (compass direction)

method.name: getPositionRules
method.text: Returns a JavaScript object array (hash). This hash contains the Y rules and the X rules for positioning the object

method.name: getPoint

param.name: objGUI
param.text: GUI object in the browser DOM (typically an HTML element such as a DIV or SPAN) for which to provide the X,Y for

param.name: strPoint
param.text: a character denoting one of the valid 9 compass points: 4 primary: (N, S, E, W); 4 secondary: (NE, SE, SW, NW); and origin: (O)

method.text: Returns a JavaScript object with properties: X,Y (Left and Top); relating to the 4 primary (N, S, E, W), 4 secondary (NE, SE, SW, NW), and origin (O) compass positions for O
